2. show the 10 most popular

The output of this macro requires some thought.

fields.description:
The current method to move a page is fairly slow and tedious;  I.e:   
(view page) --> Edit ---> Parent Page ---> (recently modified) ---> (select parent) ---> (select "Minor update") --> Update


It would be great if the Tree Viewer allowed drag & drop to move pages - I.e. drag a child page and drop it on a parent page to assign it a new parent.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop functionality in the Tree Viewer for moving pages
Special characters in macro arguments cause macro not to be recognised

Info Box
Text
{code} 1. The "information-block" class does not exist in the style sheet 2. The centering of the block is hard-coded in the macro; it really should be defined in "information-block" in the style sheet.
fields.summary: information-block not defined in stylesheet, centering is hard-coded (information block macro)

fields.description:
When editing one space's home page, and when two users opened the form where one can enter the related text,  after first user submits the home info while the other one still makes no changes, and after about  5-10 mins the other user enters some info and submits... So the last submmitter overwrites the first users info....

This means that, when i open a form page and wait for some minutes, and during these minutes another one opens the same form and edits and submits and after all these submittion, i decide to add and see that my submission is valid. and other one's info has been lost...

This seems to be a serious bug...
fields.summary: Space message entrance with two editor.

Use whitespace to delimit labels.

fields.summary: Page Picker search results are always empty

fields.description: The interface still needs to be  able to suggest common labels - one of the biggest problem with  tagging is making sure you choose the same word as everyone else for  a particular tag.
fields.summary: Support 'suggested labels'

fields.description: The recently updated page within a space does not return the latest pages or blog posts. Only comments are returned properly.
fields.summary: Recently Updated in space doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3708].
  {panel}

This is mainly for confluence once you pass a handfull of users (we have 20).  We use the page itself (in teh early stages of the lifecycle of the page) for collaboration; in the later lifecycle stages of a page we use comments for collaboration.  A user becomes the owner of the page to keep content accurate and as a target for questions.

Problem: 

1. undefined owners of page so perple are afraid to edit (expecially when i create a page - CEO) - the owner needs to know who he/she is
2. users need to knwo who to ask questions to for issues, we can see who last published to the page but ideally we would be able to ask the owner
3. Clear accountibility in an organization around certain key pieces of business (pages in confluence)
fields.summary: Make a user (optional setting) be the owner each page
Recently updated list on the dashboard should not show minor edits

fields.description: There is no documentation that explains what the consequences are of Confluence not having access to the local disk. I assume that attachments cannot be stored and searching won't work. The resolution to this issue should either be to improve the documentation or supply a switch that will automatically shut Confluence down if it can't get to the local disk. A third option would be to send a distress email to the admin if the local disk can't be reached.
fields.summary: Define consequences of no disk access.

fields.description: When in print view and comments are shown, don't show the text area for new comments.
fields.summary: Don't show comments text area in print view

fields.description: When you choose a mail via the link inserter, the subject of the name is used as the page title. That does not work. It should be [$1234] where 1234 is the id of the mail being linked to.
fields.summary: Link inserter does not correctly insert mail links

fields.description:
I would like the ability to add watches on pages on behalf of people and to assign the watch to a person or group of people.  Today I have to tell my team to subscribe to certain pages.  Ideally I would like to have some control and if I create an important page, force the watch ability.

A person can unsubscribe from a watch if they choose to do so, but I would rather have the control this way around than constantly ask people to watch pages.

Alternatively (or in addition) displaying who is watching a page would be very useful.

Thanks very much,
Sam
fields.summary: Assign page watches to individuals or groups.

fields.description:
I frequently save (ahem, update) while in the middle of editing a document so I don't lose changes (esp. since we have multiple people working on the same pages, and I have no way of knowing if someone else has started editing the page.)  Thus I need to:

* update
* look at the change (maybe)
* edit

I would like to click one button which would save the document and bring me right back to where I am.  I see several different ways this could be implemented - listed in order of _my_ preference:

# background update, so I can just keep typing (maybe popup a dialog box that says "saved").  Saves the most time (esp. if you use Atl+some key), but you don't see what you've done.
# update + preview, so it does the save, I can look at the page if I want, and I can go down back to editing.  Handy to see what you've done, but a pain b/c you still have to scroll a lot.
# update + edit, does the save and puts you right back in the edit page.  You can't see the change, and you still have to scroll down and find your spot again.

Any of these options are for "checkpoint" updates , so they probably should automatically be considered minor revisions.
fields.summary: Save + Edit

fields.description:
Page permissions are a very nice addition.  More please!  
1) Allow selection of a set of users
2) Allow selection of a set of groups
3) Both of the above at the same time
4) Restrict confluence-administrators from accessing page (see also CONF-1444)

If someone wants to put more sensitive information in Confluence to be shared with a few others but not others, then it is difficult to do unless there happens to be a group with exactly the right members in it.  Otherwise, the data has to go somewhere else defeating the purpose of a central repository.  The fact that confluence-administrators can see  the data is also a problem.  I know CONF-1444 is won't fix, but perhaps there are some alternatives that could give the same result.  For instance, can a restricted page be encrypted so that the administrator could not see any meanful data?  This would mean it would be encrypted in the backups as well!
fields.summary: Allow selection of multiple users and multiple groups (or both) for page level permissions

fields.description:
Motivation:
If the Confluence Administration General Configuration switch CamelCase Links is switched ON
all CamelCase words are treated as links. 
For some words this implicite linking is not wanted. E.g. TrackBack 

The new feature is a possiblity to suppress the implicite linking for some words.

In my mind came 2 solutions:

A) An extension of the Confluence markup language that suppresses the link generation:
A1) for a word: a prefix like \ 
A2) for a span of text: text delimited by {nocc}

B) In Index for each space where all the CamelCase words of its pages are managed.
There you can switch on/off for which words the link generation should happen.
Maybe even all the pages for CamelCase words should be created here, instead of inside the pages.

My favorite is solution B as you have a single point of control for a word. So if you later decide it makes sense to link e.g. BackLink to a page that describes it, you dont have to touch the pages with this word.
fields.summary: Suppression of CamelCase link generation for certain words

fields.description:
The current plugin manager is not very userfriendly. Dan suggested the following things:

1.  Plugin type (macro, component, xwork etc) is not displayed.

2. There is no way to filter by type (eg: I may not be interested in the internals of the plugins (such as components which a xwork action may rely on) so I would like to be able to hide it).

3. Missing dependancies - the interface allows dependancies (such as a component) to be disabled while keeping the depending plugin (such as a action) active and as such broken.

4. Searching through plugins - if you have alot of plugins installed, then it can be tiresome to find the information you want. Also searching by type would allow me to list all the components that have been plugged in or all the macros which have been added.
fields.summary: More user friendly Plugin Manager
Customisable emoticons (e.g. shortcut icons)
Allow default template to be specified

fields.description: ClassCastException when hitting the insert/edit link on the wysiwyg editor!
fields.summary: ClassCastException when hitting the insert/edit link on the wysiwyg editor.
WYSIWYG guide needed

fields.description:
Each time I change the editor - from wysiwyg to wiki markup or vice versa - my browser goes back to Confluence to load information.

This is frustrating at the best of times - as I learn wysiwyg but want to create pages quickly I have to switch between views. If the network connection is slow it makes it almost impossible.

Is it reloading the page content each time when the editor is altered?
fields.summary: WYSIWYG - changing views between wysiwyg and wiki results, each time, in a round-trip to the Confluence instance.
WYSIWYG - insert wiki markup into wysiwyg view

fields.summary: Remote API can not handle permissions for anonymus users

fields.description:
Hello,

For testing, we setup a confluence that we have entered so many page, comments to. This confluence is set up with default server configuration. However, after we have bought the confluence licence we decided to use Jira's users in our confluence. I have delegated jira's users into confluence. And installed a new confluence with zero spaces, pages, comments on it. And new data are slowly entered to the new confluence. So, is there a way to carry spaces and contents to the new confluence? 

The users will be diferent, user id's will be different. What i really want to achieve is not losing any data from the old confluence.... 

Sincerely.
fields.summary: Exporting and importing spaces between two confluence

fields.description:
For any page, if I try choose restrict edit to "myself", and save the page, another user can still edit the page, even if that user is not administrator.  When the other user opens the page, the page correctly displays "restrict edit to 'mingyi'", but the user could edit the page anyway.  Same problem happens if one tries to restrict to a group.

Restrict VIEW to "myself" or a group works fine because if I set that, no other users can view the page.  This bug just hits the edit permissions.
fields.summary: Page restrictions do not restrict Space Administrators

fields.description:
After deleting a comment on a page, searching for a unique term in the title of the page brings up the page twice in the search result.

After limiting the search-results to page, the page only comes up once. But when limited to comments, we get null object and "$webwork.htmlEncode($content.realTitle)" is displayed as a result.
fields.summary: Certain keywords lead to weird search result, most produce duplicate results

fields.description:
We still experiencing problems with non-ASCII characters in page names.
In our case "äüö" work fine, however the trouble starts when there is an uppercase umlaut in the page name, e.g. "ÄÜÖ".
The page is created and can be display /edited.
The children macro will however produce a link which is display to an non-existing page and when selected will try to create a page by that name.
fields.summary: CLONE -Still trouble with non-ASCII characters in page names

fields.description:
We need to provide broad architectural documentation that explains where to find stuff. We also need to make sure the Javadoc for our major model objects and component interfaces are complete and useful.

From a customer:

Here's an ordered list (most essential first) of the classes and 
interfaces I've mostly been using:

   * Macro
   * PageManager
   * ContentEntityObject
   * BlogPost
   * Page
   * PageContext
   * SpaceManager
   * SpaceDescription
   * WikiStyleRenderer
   * RenderContext
   * UserAccessor

If possible, I'd like to see more docs for at least the following methods:

   * Macro.execute()
   * PageManager.getRecentlyAddedBlogPosts()
   * AbstractPage.getUrlPath()
   * SpaceDescription.getRealTitle()
   * SpaceDescription.getUrlPath()
   * WikiStyleRenderer.convertWikiToXHtml()
   * RenderContext.setSiteRoot()
   * RenderContext.setImagePath()
   * RenderContext.setAttachmentsPath()

Although in many cases the method names are quite self-explaining, I 
still needed a attempts before I got the semantic details (like the sort 
order of getRecentlyAddedBlogPosts and the base of getUrlPath) figured out.
fields.summary: Document our public API

fields.description:
When external user management is enabled, two links should show on the view page: view profile and deactivate. Currently only view profile displays. 

A user's deactivation status is stored inside Confluence and hence the link should be available regardless of whether external user management has been switched on or not.

When entering a US dollar amount in a form element on a template, the subsequent "Insert Variables" step results in an error message. It declares there is a "Group X not found" error.

Test by creating a template with a textarea form element, create page from that template, enter

into the form element, then click add. You should be looking at the Oops screen.

fields.description:
It can be time consuming to upload sizeable files to a Confluence instance, across the internet. I often run into HTTP timeouts when trying to upload a 5 M file on busy sites: com.evermind.server.http.HttpIOException: Read timed out .

It would be nice to let Confluence read a directory on the host machine (or even another machine, using the correct protocol). Users could then transfer the file to this directory via scp, ftp, whatever, and then instruct Confluence to look for the upload and attach it to the current page.
fields.summary: Upload local file as attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3648].
  {panel}

It would be useful in some situations to have a Confluence page where parts of content could be set from the URL.

For instance, we have a page telling users how to set Java properties from the command-line (-Dxx=yy):

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup

This page has an example property, -Dfile.encoding, hardcoded.  It would be cool if one specify a different property from the URL, and send this to customers: 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup?prop=-Djira.jelly.on%3dtrue

Similarly, when applying 'patch' jars, the procedure is always the same, but the name of the .jar file differs.
fields.summary: Page variables, set from a URL parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3647].
  {panel}

The way we report system errors is not appropriate to the kind of application that Confluence is. When an error occurse, we should:

* Dump the summary/stats we generate for each error into a temporary file: conf-home/errors/yyyymmdd-#####.log (where ##### is some guaranteed unique number in case lots of errors happen at once)
* Display a (configurable) friendly message to the user:

"Confluence was unable to service your request because an error occurred. To report this error to a Confluence administrator, the serial number is "yyyymmdd-#####". You may _view the full details of the error here_"

* The "view the full details" link dumps the original error details. Optionally this link should be removeable, for admins who don't want strangers finding out the intimate details of their server.
* Add a pane to the administration page that summarises the errors in the log directory, and gives the admin the option to view their details, or mail them directly to confluence-support@
fields.summary: Improve system error reporting

fields.description:
The "Browse Space" interface is fractured and confused.

What would be neat is a unified "space explorer" that allowed the user to select how they wanted to view content (alphabetically, by heirarchy, most recently updated, most recently added, with or without summaries, etc), and which types of content they would like included.
fields.summary: Space Explorer

fields.description:
The links that appear in the daily change email sent by our Confluence instance are not all formatted correctly.  Links to spaces and links to "view changes" are formatted correctly, while the links to the actual pages/blogs and the links user profiles are NOT formatted correctly.  The incorrect links contain an extra application context name in the URL.  For example, a correct space link would look something like:

http://foo.bar/wiki/display/SPC

while and incorrect page link might look like :

http://foo.bar/wiki/wiki/display/SPC/Foo+Bar+Page

Note the extra /wiki in the page link example.  We have tried changing the server base URL setting from "http://foo.bar/wiki" to "http://foo.bar", which fixes the daily email problem, but breaks the short URLs to each page.
fields.summary: Malformed links in Daily Change Email
Add Ability to Export Mail Archive

fields.description: The mail tab should have a "Search mail" function. When you use the search function it excludes mail by default. Normally this is fine but when they are on the mail tab then it is confusing.
fields.summary: The mail tab should have a "Search mail" function.

fields.description:
We have a problem when trying to attach or access files with scandics in file names. We are running Confluence
Version: 1.4.1 Build:#212 Jun 02, 2005

Platform information:
----------------------
- Confluence is running on Debian platform 2.2.20-idepci
- mysql-standard-4.0.22-pc-linux-i686
- jakarta-tomcat-4.1.31


Usage scenario and problem description:
----------------------------------------
First I tried to attach a file named "Ääkkösiä nimessä.txt" into my Confluence page named "Ääkköstesti ääkkösliitteille"
1) created in my local machine
/temp/Ääkkösiä nimessä.txt

2) tried to attach above file
=> browsed the file name to "Attach file" field, inserted also comment "ääkkösiä nimestä löytyy", pressed 'Attach File'

=> got error message box with:
"The following error(s) occurred:
    * Ääkkösiä nimessä.txt does not exist."


Then I tried to access an attachment file (with scandics in name) that was attached before we upgraded to 1.4.1
3) tried to access an ääkkös-attachment attached before the Confluence upgrade => got error message bot with: "The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for."

- KB machine language: LANG=en_IN (checked by env -command)
- Checked that Confluence encoding is set to UTF-8
- Client version:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4
- Client's language was: Western ISO-8859-1 (or -15), tried also with UTF-8 encoding with no change to the problem
fields.summary: Can't attach files containing scandic characters in name
all label anchors should contain ref='tag'.

fields.description:
If you try to access a section of the site that is blocked by Seraph (e.g. admin/), but you do not have sufficient privileges, you are redirected to the login screen, even if you are already logged in. Logging in from that screen will redirect you to the admin page... which will direct you back to login because you still do not have the privileges.

The login screen should detect if the user is already logged in. If so, present a dialogue saying: "You do not have permission to access <url>. To access this page, please log in below as a user with sufficient permissions." (Provide some kind of obvious escape-link to the dashboard)
fields.summary: Login redirects are sometimes confusing

fields.description:
CAC went down with the errors attached to this issue. 

Scott wrote:

Here seems to be the offending statement (well, apart from the Webwork one):

  "Thread-1" daemon prio=1 tid=0x8dbace98 nid=0x18d waiting for monitor entry [8d994000..8d99486c]
        at java.util.LinkedList.clone(LinkedList.java:602)
        at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.cloneOfUnused(BasicResourcePool.java:1044)
        at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.cullExpiredAndUnused(BasicResourcePool.java:934)
        at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.access$800(BasicResourcePool.java:31)
        at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$CullTask.run(BasicResourcePool.java:1138)
        - locked <0x931f2c20> (a com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool)
        at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:432)
        at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:382)

Seems that the resource pool has a timed tast that does something. However, it seems like that must take quite a long time?
fields.summary: Timed Resource Pool caused Confluence to crash

fields.summary: Weblogic 9 deployment problems

fields.description: There is a bug in the current implementation of the tasklist macro that allows duplicate items to show up in the list if they have trailing spaces. So "apple" and "apple " would be erroneously considered different. When these similar items are marked as complete in Confluence, two entries are inserted into the OS_PROPERTYENTRY table. When these entries are exported to XML however, the trailing spaces are removed, so the second item is actually written to the XML file as a duplicate of the first. When this backup is restored, you will get a SQL duplicate key exception as Confluence tries to re-insert "apple" (without trailing space).
fields.summary: Tasklist macro allows duplicate items if items contain trailing spaces

fields.description:
If you are experiencing problems in restore of your backup data due to SQL duplicate key exceptions, it may be caused by having duplicate items in the tasklists. 

There is a bug in the current implementation of the tasklist macro that allows duplicate items to show up in the list if they have trailing spaces. So "apple" and "apple    " would be erroneously considered different. When these similar items are marked as complete in Confluence, two entries are inserted into the OS_PROPERTYENTRY table. When these entries are exported to XML however, the trailing spaces are removed, so the second item is actually written to the XML file as a duplicate of the first. When this backup is restored, you will get a SQL duplicate key exception as Confluence tries to re-insert "apple" (without trailing space).
fields.summary: Duplicate tasklist macro items cause SQL duplicate key exception on restore

fields.description:
Atom 1.0 has just been released, and the Atom WG are asking everyone to use 1.0 and drop support for 0.3.

Confluence should, some time in the next six months, transition from generating Atom0.3 feeds to Atom1.0 and remove support for generating 0.3 (it should still be able to parse 0.3 in the {rss} macro, though).

As such, we should warn people in the Yarra release notes that this will happen.
fields.summary: Release-notes warning about Atom 0.3

fields.description:
Because the full reindex is multi-threaded, the progress-meter reports the status of the last thread to update the progress-meter, not necessarily the thread that is doing the work. So for example:

Thread one starts indexing a huge PDF.
Thread two starts indexing a page
Thread two stops indexing a page
Thread one freezes and dies.

The progress meter now reads "Indexing: Page Blah", but the index has actually frozen on "Indexing: Big-ass PDF".

We should either report the status of all threads in a hideable DHTML twistie, or we should have some kind of push-pop stack of messages so that when an operation completes, its message is popped off the stack and any message hidden underneath is restored.
fields.summary: Re-indexing progress meter lies

fields.description:
Both RSS and Atom have (separate) auto-discovery protocols that allow you to put a <link> tag in the page header that directs the browser to that page's relevant RSS/Atom feed.

We should have these auto-discovery tags for:

* Dashboard (All recently updated content)
* Space recently updated page (Space recently updated content)
* Recent blogs page (Space recently added blogs)
* User profile page (Content recently updated by user)

(Note - blogs page is recently ADDED, not updated - because this is how most blog RSS feeds work)
fields.summary: RSS Auto-discovery

fields.description:
Need to include the confluence release date in the download so that when a customer builds from source, they can do so without fear of triggering the license restrictions.

See email below for full details:

----------------------------
Also, as a suggestion to pass along to the licensing folks. If a licensed organization like ourselves are able to download a particular version of the source, we may rebuild the war at any time without making changes to Atlassian source. We are currently rebuilding the war because of changes to an authentication mechanism we use for SSO. This only requires a change to a seraph xml file in the Atlassian source and the inclusion of a new package from our organization.

In addition, it seems like if I were to rebuild our 1.3.X war which we have used for the last year,  now it would also not work. The licensing information on your website (http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/pricing.jsp) states (or at least to us it does) that we can use any release that comes out during the maintenance period we paid for. It seems dangerous to have clients that can download a particular verion of the source and have it build and run and then because they rebuild it after a certain date, the application no longer works. Luckily, this has only affected our development/test environment and not our production environment. 
---------------------------
fields.summary: Licensing needs to be dependant on release date, not build date, otherwise customer can not build from source.

fields.description:
This is a list of the tables in used in Confluence as of version 1.4.2: 

SPACEPERMISSIONS
TRACKBACKLINKS 
CONTENTLOCK
PAGETEMPLATES
os_user_group
EXTRNLNKS
NOTIFICATIONS 
ATTACHMENTS 
os_user 
SPACES 
os_group
CONTENT 
ANCESTORS
LINKS 
OS_PROPERTYENTRY 

If any of these tables in exist in other oracle schemas in the "same database", those tables will _not_ be created, impairing bits of Confluence functionality that depend on those table(s). 

The bug is tied to this hibernate SchemaUpdate bug: 

http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HB-534

This problem also affects PostgreSQL.

h3. Workaround
This issue only occurs if the database user you are connecting to Oracle with has permission to view all tables across the database, not just those that relate to its own schema. You need to ensure you have followed all the steps in the [Database Setup for Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-oracle-173821.html] document. The relevant ones here are the local all objects view, and ensuring that 'select any table' is not granted. However, all steps in that document need to be followed to avoid running into other issues down the track.
fields.summary: Problem installing on Oracle schema when other schemas in the same database have one or more tables sharing the same name as any of Confluence's tables

fields.description:
Hi,
I'd like some advice on how best to handle this permission setup.
Within a space, we have a variety of projects for a client, each with their own pages, which in turn have child pages. The home page of the space also has summary information about the status of all projects. On one of these projects, we're working with another company, and we need to grant them access to a few of the child pages in one project. We don't want them to be able to see the home page (summary), project home page, or any of the other projects.
I can see how to do this with page level permissions if both the space home page and project home pages only contained a list of children (then the other children just wouldn't show up)- but in this case these home pages contain sensitive information that we don't want to reveal.
Any suggestions on how best to set this up?

thanks

Ben
fields.summary: how to grant permissions to lower level pages in a space, without showing the upper levels
